Michael Cruz

Full-Stack Web Developer

  linkedin.com/in/michaelgcruz |   github.com/cruz02148

Summary

I am a full-stack software engineer with a strong background in JavaScript. I particularly enjoy working on the front-end and using the latest technologies and techniques. When looking to build out a feature or fix a bug, I first look at any and all ways to solve the problem before writing any code down, which ensures that when I do start coding I am confident my approach is the best one. I love working in settings where autonomy is expected and valued, but teamwork is also vital to the ultimate success of the project. Whether I'm working on a brand new feature or fixing the smallest bug, I approach everything with 100% commitment and effort and can be expected to get the job done.

Recent Projects

Sparkq | Full-Stack Engineer

Web app where couples go to gauge their relationship and offers suggestions for improvement
  • Built the ability for users to signup/signin with their passwords safely hashed by creating a token-based user authentication feature across the stack using React/Redux, Node, and MongoDB
  • Architected and built a calendar feature using React, Redux, Redux-Form, and React-Big-Calendar to allow users belonging to the same couple to view, create, and delete shared events
  • Enabled users to connect to Fitbit’s API using Express, Redux, and PostgreSQL to let users in a couple compete with each with the winner getting more points added to their account
  • Led the team in integrating client side testing using Mocha, Chai, and Enzyme to ensure our containers, actions, and reducers were modeled and constructed correctly

Barter Box | Full-Stack Engineer

The Airbnb for everything else - furniture, tickets, equipment, and more
  • Integrated social sharing using React-Social, allowing users to share any item to Facebook, Twitter, or Pinterest
  • Implemented form validation using Redux-Form and Formsy giving users instant feedback on errors and ensuring the back-end would receive proper inputs

Pocket Trainer | Full-Stack Engineer

Web app that provides a set of recommended workouts based on a user’s goals
  • Developed the front-end using React and Material-UI delivering a clean UI focusing on Material Design language
  • Configured API endpoints using Node/Express to allow for fast and intuitive data access
